intro: Lankesterella gnomus, commonly known as the fairy orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricately shaped flowers that resemble tiny fairy figures. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rocky substrates or in dense undergrowth. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with intricate patterns that help in attracting specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Lankesterella gnomus is considered a vulnerable species.
